column5: iv looked around for a new float rod and i came across a 13 ft kingpin im8 for 180, is it a good deal? said reg 400??
dont know, iv looked them up on google but nothing really came up but i seen a guy on the river with one
From what I've heard the best bang for the buck rods out there are the Streamside and Raven RV9.
they are very very good almost bulletproof  i'd buy give me # if your not interested
Yup. Only difference are the titanium Fuji guides and the sticker logo.  The Streamsides are decent performing rods at a great price (Around $130).

I think that Jos has regular and upgraded streamsides ,with the up graded being  equivalent to the Kingpin rods and priced cheaper than the kingpin rods. I would call Anglers Outfitters in Woodstock and see if he still has some in stock.
so would it be a good idea to get it bc im only 15 min away from where the guy lives
Since you live in B.C. you may be better off buying from the guy 15 min. away. Certainly the option I gave you is no good because of where you live.
I don't think he lives in BC, I think 'bc' meant 'because'  I still wouldn't pay an extra $60 for a KingPin over a Streamside.
ya lol i meant because and i think i might just get the kingpin   another question, sliding rings or fixed
For me Delvin, no question, FIXED!  Just need to know where you like your reel positioned.
right in the middle  well just abit up from the middle so theres a little more room att the back
FWIW, there are $100 worth of guides on the Kingpin 13'2 pc rod. So $180 for the rod with a replacement guarantee from Angling Outfitters? No Brainer.
